entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 6:14AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM MDT SUNDAY FOR EASTERN ARCHULETA COUNTY... LAST EVENING...EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT REPORTED HEAVY RAIN CAUSED MINOR FLOODING ALONG THE RIO BLANCO RIVER IN SOUTHEASTERN ARCHULETA COUNTY. MORE RAIN IS EXPECTED TODAY...CONTINUING THE THREAT OF MINOR FLOODING IN THE AREA.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 2:01PM MDT until June 09 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY FOR RAIN AND SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN EAGLE COUNTY... AT 155 PM MDT...GAUGES AND RIVER FORECASTS INDICATE THAT RIVER LEVELS WILL REACH ABOVE BANKFULL AND CAUSE MINOR FLOODING IN THE ADVISORY AREA. ADDITIONAL RAIN AND SNOW MELT THIS WEEKEND WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE INCREASED FLOW.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 12:18PM MDT until June 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a flood advisory for the Roaring Fork River... Roaring Fork River near Aspen affecting Pitkin County .Water levels along the Roaring Fork near Aspen will increase to above bankfull later tonight and remain high for the next 5 to 6 days. Minor flooding of low lying areas near the river is possible.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 07 at 3:57AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING THREAT POSSIBLE THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY... entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 07 at 5:16AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALIZED FLOODING POSSIBLE THIS EVENING INTO MONDAY... THUNDERSTORMS WILL PRODUCE HEAVY RAIN LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO THE OVERNIGHT AS A SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTERSECTS A VERY MOIST AIRMASS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE ONE TO TWO INCHES WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE WHERE STORMS PERSIST. THE BEST CHANCES FOR THESE HEAVIER AMOUNTS WILL

The Flood Warning continues for The Trinity River In Liberty * until further notice...or until the warning is canceled. * At 0715 AM Sunday the stage was 29.6 feet. * Major flooding is occurring and Major flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 06 at 1:27PM CDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE ACTION DAY SUNDAY... THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (TCEQ)...HAS ISSUED AN OZONE ACTION DAY FOR THE HOUSTON...GALVESTON...AND BRAZORIA AREAS FOR SUNDAY JUNE 7, 2015. ATMOSPHERIC CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE FAVORABLE FOR PRODUCING HIGH LEVELS OF OZONE POLLUTION IN THE HOUSTON...GALVESTON AND

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:45AM PDT until June 08 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A VERY WARM DAY IS IN STORE FOR AREAS FROM AROUND SEATTLE SOUTHWARD IN THE INTERIOR TODAY... TODAY WILL BE SUNNY AND WARM WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S TO NEAR 90 FROM ABOUT SEATTLE AND BELLEVUE SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE SOUTHWEST INTERIOR OF WESTERN WASHINGTON. THE WARMEST TEMPERATURES WILL OCCUR LATE THIS AFTERNOON IN TYPICALLY WARMER URBAN AREAS.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bellevue and Vicinity; East Puget Sound Lowlands; Seattle and Vicinity; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued June 07 at 4:05AM PDT until June 08 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BREEZY WITH LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY KITTITAS VALLEY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... .WINDS WILL BECOME BREEZY IN THE KITTITAS VALLEY ON MONDAY WHICH COMBINED WITH LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL RESULT IN THE POTENTIAL FOR RAPID FIRE SPREAD WITH ANY NEW FIRE STARTS. FUELS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUING DRYING...LIKELY REACHING CRITICAL LEVELS

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 07 at 3:55AM PDT until June 08 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY FOR THE WILLAMETTE VALLEY AND THE GREATER PORTLAND AND VANCOUVER METRO AREA... THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN PORTLAND HAS ISSUED A HEAT ADVISORY...WHICH IS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 8:48PM MDT until June 10 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: * Flood Warning continues for The Laramie River at Laramie * The stage will crest around 8.2 feet Tuesday morning. * The stage will fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. && Flood impacts and crest history information is displayed at:

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 8:37PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flood Warning for The Laramie River near Fort Laramie. * from late tonight until further notice. * Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 7.0 feet later tonight and remain at 7.0 feet through the remainder of the week.
